00039 #ifdef PACC_SOCKET_WIN32
00041 #include <winsock2.h>

00050 using namespace std;

00052 
00054 Socket::Error Socket::Exception::convertNativeError(int inError)
00055 {
00056     Error lCode;
00057     switch(inError)
00058     {
00059 #ifdef PACC_SOCKET_WIN32
00060         case WSAEACCES: lCode = ePrivilegedPort; break;
00061         case WSAEADDRINUSE: lCode = eAddressInUse; break;
00062         case WSAEADDRNOTAVAIL: lCode = eAddressNotAvailable; break;
00063         case WSAECONNREFUSED: lCode = eConnectionRefused; break;
00064         case WSAECONNRESET: lCode = eConnectionClosed; break;
00065         case WSAEHOSTDOWN: lCode = eConnectionRefused; break;
00066         case WSAEHOSTUNREACH: lCode = eConnectionRefused; break;
00067         case WSAEINTR: lCode = eConnectionClosed; break;
00068         case WSAEISCONN: lCode = eIsConnected; break;
00069         case WSAEMSGSIZE: lCode = eDatagramTooLong; break;
00070         case WSAENETRESET: lCode = eConnectionClosed; break;
00071         case WSAENOPROTOOPT: lCode = eInvalidOption; break;
00072         case WSAENOTCONN: lCode = eNotConnected; break;
00073         case WSANOTINITIALISED: lCode = eBadDescriptor; break;
00074         case WSAENOTSOCK: lCode = eBadDescriptor; break;
00075         case WSAEOPNOTSUPP: lCode = eOpNotSupported; break;
00076         case WSAESHUTDOWN: lCode = eBadDescriptor; break;
00077         case WSAETIMEDOUT: lCode = eTimeOut; break;
00078 #else
00079         case EACCES: lCode = ePrivilegedPort; break;
00080         case EADDRINUSE: lCode = eAddressInUse; break;
00081         case EADDRNOTAVAIL: lCode = eAddressNotAvailable; break;
00082         case EAGAIN: lCode = eTimeOut; break;
00083         case EBADF: lCode = eBadDescriptor; break;
00084         case ECONNREFUSED: lCode = eConnectionRefused; break;
00085         case ECONNRESET: lCode = eConnectionClosed; break;
00086         case EINTR: lCode = eConnectionClosed; break;
00087         case EISCONN: lCode = eIsConnected; break;
00088         case EMSGSIZE: lCode = eDatagramTooLong; break;
00089         case ENOPROTOOPT: lCode = eInvalidOption; break;
00090         case ENOTCONN: lCode = eNotConnected; break;
00091         case ENOTSOCK: lCode = eBadDescriptor; break;
00092         case EPIPE: lCode =eConnectionClosed; break;
00093         case ETIMEDOUT: lCode = eTimeOut; break;
00094 #endif
00095         default: lCode = eOtherError;
00096     }
00097     return lCode;
00098 }
00099 
00100 string Socket::Exception::getMessage() const throw()
00101 {
00102     ostringstream lMessage;
00103     switch(mCode)
00104     {
00105         case eAddressInUse: lMessage << "address in use"; break;
00106         case eAddressNotAvailable: lMessage << "address not available"; break;
00107         case eBadDescriptor: lMessage << "bad descriptor"; break;
00108         case eBadMessage: lMessage << "bad message"; break;
00109         case eConnectionClosed: lMessage << "connection closed"; break;
00110         case eConnectionRefused: lMessage << "connection refused"; break;
00111         case eDatagramTooLong: lMessage << "datagram too long"; break;
00112         case eInvalidOption: lMessage << "invalid option"; break;
00113         case eIsConnected: lMessage << "is connected"; break;
00114         case eNotConnected: lMessage << "not connected"; break;
00115         case eOpNotSupported: lMessage << "operation not supported"; break;
00116         case ePrivilegedPort: lMessage << "privileged port"; break;
00117         case eTimeOut: lMessage << "time out"; break;
00118         default: lMessage << "other error"; break;
00119     }
00120     if(mNativeCode) lMessage << " (" << mNativeCode << ")";
00121     return string("Socket ")+lMessage.str()+":\n"+what();
00122 }
